content: alice s wool works before you begin details construction this book pouch/sleeve is worked in a single flat piece starting by covering the front then increasing to cover the binding and the pages then decreasing to cover the back two seams are added at the end to join the sides and create an open rectangular prism as well as four strings to close the opening sizing this pattern is designed to be easily adjusted to fit any book and to work with any yarn weight so the number of stitches and row included between parentheses at the end of each row are only there as references but if adjustments are made the numbers need to remain odd or even depending on the given reference for example the reference given for the foundation chain is 35 chains odd number so the adjusted number of chains has to remain odd the same goes for the number of row for example you might need to adjust the width of your book sleeve the reference number for the row of the front and back cover is 19 row odd number so the adjusted number of row has to remain odd if this rule is not followed the pattern might get hard to follow for reference here are the measurements of the book i used in the making of this pattern length 20 cm width 13 cm height 2 5 cm photo 1 2 alice s wool works materials yarn any yarn can be used for this project i recommend using a medium-weight yarn but this can truly be done with any other yarn keep in mind that the lighter the yarn the higher the yardage lighter yarns also tend to make a thinner fabric if you want a thicker and more protective book pouch i recommend using a heavier yarn i used bernat premium acrylic yarn in the color white sparkle 1 hook use the hook size prescribed to your yarn or 0 5 mm bigger i used a 5 mm hook many stitch markers i personally use stitch markers to keep track of the first stitch of every row it helps to prevent accidental stitch drops i move the markers up every time i begin a new row you will also need stitch markers for the seaming part 1 yarn needle to weave in the ends abbreviations rs = right side ws = wrong side r = row st s = stitch es chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet notes - this pattern is written in us crochet terminology - chain 1 at the beginning of each row does not count as a st - images are shown for left handed crocheting 3 alice s wool works pattern instructions part1-singlepannel foundation chain chain 35 or the amount needed to reach the length of your book - make sure it is an odd number 35
